Texas floods: Search for missing continues as death toll rises past 80
subhead: Three days after the devastating floods, the death toll at the summer camp and elsewhere in Kerr County rose to at least 82 on Monday. President Donald Trump said he would 'probably' visit Texas on Friday.

title: Macron heads to UK for first official visit of King Charles III's reign
subhead: French President Emmanuel Macron and his wife Brigitte are to arrive at Windsor Castle on Tuesday for the first state visit of the reign of King Charles III. Macron will also address UK MPs during a three-day visit expected to improve a Franco-British relationship strained by Brexit.

title: In Bosnia and Herzegovina, stone treasures, canyons and cypress trees await
subhead: The Balkan country, with its painful past, is rich in historical sites and mountainous landscapes − from the Kravica Waterfalls to the Olympic sites of Sarajevo, from a medieval fortress to Tito's bunker.

title: The Oder Bridge between Germany and Poland: The decline of a European symbol
subhead: After Berlin reinstated border checks to block migrants at the bridge in Frankfurt an der Oder, Warsaw responded with similar measures, disrupting daily life for locals. Once emblematic of the European Union's eastward expansion, the site now bears witness to the rise of xenophobic sentiment.
byline: By Elsa Conesa (Frankfurt an der Oder (Germany), Slubice (Poland), special correspondent)

title: The relentless rush to build dams in China's Tiger Leaping Gorge: 'If we lose our land, we lose everything'
subhead: 'The Himalayas Overheating' (5/6). In the far southwest of China, plans to build massive reservoirs as part of hydroelectric dam projects have condemned dozens of mountain villages to disappear.

title: Iranian photographer Forough Alaei portrays life during the war: 'Nothing will ever be the same again'
subhead: After the first Israeli bombings in Iran, Iranian photographer Forough Alaei left Tehran to take refuge with her family on the Caspian Sea coast. She documented those days when war plunged them into the unknown.
byline: By Forough Alaei (Photos) and Audrey Delaporte

title: Starlink: The newest asset for rebel and jihadist groups in West Africa
subhead: Billionaire Elon Musk's satellite internet system has become an increasingly common tool for armed groups to communicate in areas lacking traditional land-based communications infrastructure.
